contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Officeholder | honorific-prefix = | name = James Mitchell | image = | caption = | birth_date = March 16, 1843 | birth_place = [[Scotch Settlement, New Brunswick|Scotch Settlement]], [[York County, New Brunswick|York County]], [[New Brunswick]], [[Canada]] {{flagicon|Canada}} | death_date = {{death date and age|1897|12|15|1843|3|16}} | death_place = [[St. Stephen, New Brunswick|St. Stephen]], [[Charlotte County, New Brunswick|Charlotte County]], New Brunswick, Canada {{flagicon|Canada}} | restingplace = [[St. Stephen Rural Cemetery]] | order = 8th [[Premier of New Brunswick]] | term_start = 17 July 1896 | term_end = 29 October 1897 | predecessor = [[Andrew George Blair]] | successor = [[Henry Emmerson]] | party = [[New Brunswick Liberal Association|Liberal]] | alma_mater = Fredericton Collegiate School, [[University of New Brunswick]] | religion = [[Presbyterian]] | spouse = Mary Anne Ryder }} '''James Mitchell''' (March 16, 1843 – December 15, 1897) was a politician in the [[New Brunswick|Province of New Brunswick, Canada]]. Prior to entering [[politics]], Mitchell was a [[schoolteacher]] and a prominent [[lawyer]] in [[St. Stephen, New Brunswick]]. In 1882 he was elected to the provincial [[legislature]] as a [[Liberal Party of New Brunswick|Liberal]] [[Legislative Assembly|MLA]]. Appointed to the [[Executive Council of New Brunswick|Executive Council]], he served as [[Department of Natural Resources (New Brunswick)|Surveyor-General]], [[Department of Agriculture (New Brunswick)|Commissioner of Agriculture]], [[Department of Finance (New Brunswick)|Receiver-General and Provincial Secretary]]. James Mitchell became the [[List of premiers of New Brunswick|eighth]] [[Premier of New Brunswick|Premier]] in 1896 but resigned in 1897 due to ill health and died shortly thereafter. == References == *{{Canadabio|ID=6300 |name=James Mitchell}} {{NBPremiers}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Mitchell, James | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH =March 16, 1843 | PLACE OF BIRTH =[[Scotch Settlement, New Brunswick|Scotch Settlement]], [[York County, New Brunswick|York County]], [[New Brunswick]], [[Canada]] | DATE OF DEATH =1897-12-15 | PLACE OF DEATH =[[St. Stephen, New Brunswick|St. Stephen]], [[Charlotte County, New Brunswick|Charlotte County]], New Brunswick, Canada }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Mitchell, James}} [[Category:1843 births]] [[Category:1897 deaths]] [[Category:University of New Brunswick alumni]] [[Category:Canadian schoolteachers]] [[Category:Lawyers in New Brunswick]] [[Category:Members of the Executive Council of New Brunswick]] [[Category:Premiers of New Brunswick]] [[Category:People from York County, New Brunswick]] [[Category:People from Charlotte County, New Brunswick]] {{NewBrunswick-politician-stub}}
